meanings.sent1: She always gives her opinion disinterestedly, without thinking about what she will gain.
meanings.sent2: The judge made a disinterestedly fair decision based solely on the evidence presented.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed to watch the mouse disinterestedly, as if it had better things to do.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted the landscape disinterestedly, capturing its beauty without personal attachment.
meanings.sent5: The scientist observed the experiment disinterestedly, focusing only on the results.

meanings.definition: In a fair and impartial manner
meanings.sent1: He listened disinterestedly to both sides of the argument before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: The journalist reported the news disinterestedly, without favoring any particular viewpoint.
meanings.sent3: The robot served tea disinterestedly, not caring who drank it as long as it was poured.
meanings.sent4: The wind blew disinterestedly through the trees, unaware of the chaos it caused.
meanings.sent5: The teacher graded the tests disinterestedly, focusing only on the answers given.
